page.title: 02WESTCOTT LANDSCAPE
page.content:
{ }The Westcott area was covered in swamps, salt lakes and lagoons. Dinosaurs roamed here and ferns, conifers and horsetails grew here. Millions of years later Dorking became covered in fresh water which gave us a surface of{weald clay, lower greensand {gault clay}and{upper greensand.} The North Downs are{chalk}hills with a cap of{clay and flint}covered with trees - mainly oak and beech. Part of the woodland has been cleared for grazing land. The steep scarp slope has thin light grey soil and at the foot, on the{upper greensand,}runs the Reading Gatwick railway line which passes through Dorking.
{ }
